tweets.text:
NEW: Soil pollution is damaging Herefordshire's rivers and hitting fish species. 
Officers from @EnvAgencyMids are inspecting hundreds of recently harvested fields at risk from heavy rain, reminding farmers what steps they can take. Enforcement action could follow.@DaveThroupEA https://t.co/N5H3UQiaBQ

@bathenganddes @UniofBath @CIWEM @InstWater @EPSRC @NERCscience @UK_WIR @The_UKWP @IWAHQ @UK_CEH @WISECDT @GW4FreshCDT @FutureWaterAsso @British_Water @WaterUK @WaterIForum Day 2 begins with a panel discussion:

'The state of English and Welsh Rivers'

Chair: @SteveOrmerod, Cardiff Uni

Panellists:  Arlin Rickard of @theriverstrust; @acrharrington of @DwrCymru; @alicertchie of @CLAtweets; Helen Wakeham of @EnvAgency; Mark Squire of @NatResWales

‚ö†Ô∏è We use a network of boreholes across Dorset and Wiltshire to monitor groundwater levels. When the thresholds are met, we issue Groundwater Flood Alerts and warnings. Go to https://t.co/AvKymXWwCL to monitor your local borehole #Groundwater ‚ö†Ô∏è https://t.co/S8JW8nc8sF

We are excited to announce that our online 2020 Conference, 24-26 Nov, @NatInvest will feature three of six webinars in the Investment Readiness Fund series hosted by @GFI_green on behalf of @EnvAgency and @DefraGovUK. Book your free place now  
https://t.co/ZTGYZyvfl4 https://t.co/03VgoMFD5D

tweets.text:
Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O

Revising our 2020 Catchment Action Plan today. Thanks to our core partners @CheshireWT @GroundworkCLM @merseyforest @merseyrivers @envagencyNW @UnitedUtilities @RH_EmployerHub @associates_elm @natural_course @NENorthWest We have ALOT of projects in delivery. Let‚Äôs shout about it! https://t.co/Vc3iKkrnl5

Our successes against waste crime again on national TV

At #Havant, on the south coast, four men dumped rubbish on private land

‚Ä¶and set fire to it, to cover their tracks. Only they didn‚Äôt. We caught them

Full story, 11am, #BBC1: https://t.co/HhOe4L3ViJ https://t.co/scnAqH2yBj

Here's that New Clause 24 - amendment to the #EnvironmentBill 

Will the Office for Environmental Protection (OEP) remain 'independent' with this in place? 

I invite you to judge for yourself.... https://t.co/4izTvkiWLy
WATCH Becca and Alice invertebrate sampling on the #Wandle #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/I53WP67pbN

@EnvAgencySE @EnvAgency Hi Paula, yes I did back in early September - the reference number in my tweets was the one I was quoted. I also reported it in January and March before lockdown happened. I would really appreciate elevated urgency to get this fixed

tweets.text: @easylec @EnvAgency Does that mean it doesn‚Äôt have to be in an eco-bag but does need to be put into a specific dog poo bin?

Protect your pipes and the environment.

Never put wet wipes, cotton pads or kitchen towel down the toilet.

Let‚Äôs keep our environment healthy.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/UPDBWtGbj4

Anyone who knows @WoodlandTrust #SmihtillsEstate knows it‚Äôs wet! We‚Äôre carrying out #NaturalFloodManagement works to hold back the flows of water to help water subside better down stream @livuni @EnvAgencyNW @merseyforest https://t.co/LwQgBNOTaW
@RoryCopus @EnvAgency Good morning. Has this been reported via our incident hotline - Telephone: 0800 80 70 60? Thanks, Paula

This October #HalfTerm do your bit to keep our bathing waters safe for all to enjoy! üåä 

Bag up your dog poo and put it in the bin even if you're no where near a beach! 

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/277IQvQOYA

@EnvAgency @EnvAgencySE I thought I would try and find the gauge station myself, to see how hard it actually was. Turns out, pretty easy üíÅüèº‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è I‚Äôve included a photo of the map reference, to help you guys find it too, so that you can fix it. Ref # 1852967 (2/2) https://t.co/Q7k0mph3H6

Are you new to #NaturalFloodManagement and funding? If so, then we need your help. We‚Äôre working on a project to make it easier for people to find funding for #NFM projects and would love to hear your thoughts. 

If you can help, get in touch here üëâhttps://t.co/jRjHj3kY35 https://t.co/PNPrSQBsfU

Yesterday, @DaveThroupEA tweeted a video of salmon at a weir. 

Today, with only my small lens I went to hopefully capture my first glimpse of the salmon run in the wild. 

Oh my god - just incredible. I somehow managed these photos! 

@BBCCountryfile @bbcweather @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YWEv3V9no4

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

Scientists are now testing sewage samples to detect local #coronavirus outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.

This is a valuable step in supporting NHS Test and Trace.

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbk0ofA

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/4xdR82CtJo

Worth reading 

Kashmir: Pakistan‚Äôs Lost Cause - Chanakya Forum Chanakya Forum https://t.co/AQEsjQsPej
@EnvAgency What happens to all the plastic wrapped poo?
@EnvAgency Guys, please communicate need for eco-friendly poo bags, as part of this. Otherwise you‚Äôre just replacing one type of pollution for another #joinedupthinking #eco

Kitchen roll is one of the top 3 #unflushables people admit to having flushed down the loo. 
 
However, unlike toilet paper it doesn't dissolve and instead causes blockages. 
 
Never flush kitchen roll. 
 
Protect your pipes and our environment.

#Unblocktober #BinIt4Beaches https://t.co/NUg5UumjEq

A message for farmers‚ö†Ô∏è

We are having a lot of rain, so please check lagoons and tanks to make sure you have a freeboard of 750mm for lagoons and 300mm for tanks.

Guidance here: https://t.co/NqhOabhur4 #rain #Farmers https://t.co/fq10dsosJw

The Environment Agency will be running a Flood Action Week campaign in England from 9th to 15th November. They‚Äôll help people to understand the risks of flooding and how to stay safe, including while they‚Äôre driving.

Follow @EnvAgency on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. https://t.co/RHYPcpTiTs

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace
